availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George H. Perrin (Harrison County, KY, farmer and physician.)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and physician. Lincoln County, Kentucky, native. Son of Josephus Perrin and Elizabeth Perrin. Married to Arabella Edwards Perrin in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on November 27, 1819. Graduate of Transylvania University in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky. Physician in Harrison County in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 118A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 387.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 107A-B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183145.
William Henry Perrin, ed., History of Bourbon, Scott, Harrison and Nicholas Counties, Kentucky., (Chicago: O.L. Baskin & Co., 1882), pp. 672-674.
"Dr George Hurd Perrin (1794-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #168781749, accessed September 22, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/168781749/george-hurd-perrin.
